summary:
I am an experienced IT Professional with a decade of expertise in Technical/Business Consulting. As an ITIL certified professional, I possess a comprehensive understanding and hands-on experience in Change Management, Incident/Problem Management, Release/Deployment Management, and Stakeholder management. I thrive on responsibilities and enjoy working with people. During my leisure time, I indulge in activities such as Traveling, Driving, and Acrylic painting.
Some of my key strengths include effective communication and influencing skills, strong coordination abilities, the ability to handle high-stress situations, a results-driven mindset, a customer-focused approach, adept stakeholder management, and a genuine commitment to teamwork.

school.name: Sagar Institute of Research Technology & Science (SIRTS), Bhopal - 462041

certifications.name: ITIL Foundation in IT Service Management

publications.name: So far journey to The Netherlands!

profile_positions.description:
Vanderlande Test & Deployment Team is an internationally operating service organization department for our customers in the Warehousing and Parcel business units. Apart from the traditional service delivery aligned with ITIL (Incident, Problem & Change Management) we are also dedicated to continue developing ourselves as a business partner for our customers.

As a test and deploy manager I am responsible for:
End to end process for release, test and deployment in accordance with ITSM (IT Service Management) (Change Management) (Stakeholder Management)
Managing, creating, planning the production software changes aligned with customer requests
Managing the execution of deployment in Production together with test and DevOps team
Leading test & Deploy (DevOps) team (10+ resources), responsible for setting up the right priorities, getting work done for quality delivery and customer satisfaction
Translating technical scope to business language
Coaching team for their professional growth
profile_positions.title: Project/Change And Release Manager/Software

profile_positions.description:
Vanderlande Global Services is responsible for the development and implementation of Life-cycle Services to our systems worldwide.
As IT & Application Support Engineer I was responsible in a team of specialists with the task of analyzing and solving operating issues related to material handling systems of our airport customers.

Helped the customer locate and troubleshoot faults in the baggage handling system (incident management), analyze root causes to find definitive solutions (problem management) and advises on changes (change management) to the system. Preparing, testing and executing these changes.

To our local Vanderlande service organizations spread worldwide, my team is the center for high level controls software related issues that cannot be solved locally, therefore form an important link between the different service organizations and internal departments, while regularly communicating directly with customers.
profile_positions.title: Application Controls Support Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Maintained and modified the implementation of the ASML engineering IT infrastructure and application
landscape, in co-operation with the internal customer and Solution Team System Architect. Support for
2nd/3rd line questions related to our supported services. Focus on Multi-disciplinary Engineering
processes, engineering applications, supporting infra (Linux/Windows hosting, storage, databases).
profile_positions.title: Sr. IT Analyst

profile_positions.description: Received training on personal & professional growth for a corporate networking event called "ESI Live tech" organized by Expat Spouses Initiative. I was one of the participant of this event.
profile_positions.title: Professional Growth Workshop

profile_positions.description: Received training on Web Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Tealium Tag Manager.
profile_positions.title: Bootcamp

profile_positions.description:
Role: Application Support Specialist/ IT Consultant
Team Size: 15
Client: Procter and Gamble [P&G]
Technologies Used: JAVA, Eclipse, Groovy on grails, GGTS, Oracle 10g, UNIX, HP Service Manager, SVN [Subversion/Tortoise], Harvest, Jenkins, SQL, remote desktop connections, window servers, active directories, Log viewer, lotus notes and Application Based Tools.
Responsibilities: 24 x 7 Support
•	Ensured & followed ITIL Process.
•	Major Task: Enhancement, Debugging, Bug fixing, Deployment, Testing, Monitoring application logs, Handled/managed critical escalations, co-ordination between multiple teams during deployments. 
•	Provided root cause analysis and permanent solution for the critical issues.
•	Created Knowledgebase for the several issues and processes.
•	Migrations/Deployments: New application Developed/Enhanced and New functionalities in application to different server/ environments (including PROD).
•	UNIX Job Processing: Ran on daily basis CONTROL-M jobs, preprocessing and post processing in an optimized way for critical applications.
•	Change Management Process: Process owner ensured smooth working of the change lifecycle from development to deployment in production from change request to Change Advisory Board (CAB) to post implementation review.
•	Incident management & problem management: Solved issues within the given SLA’s for IMs (Incident) & PRs (Problem Records)
profile_positions.title: Application Support Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Team Size: 7
Client: Procter and Gamble [P&G]
Software/Tool Used: HP Service Manager [SM], Excel, Application frontend & Application servers
Responsibilities:
•	Ensured project compliance with ITIL guidelines for the specific technical platform. 
•	Ensured project compliance with Change Management process and success of production change implementation, testing, post implementations & CAB meeting guidelines.
•	Ensured test preparation and execution for UAT/PROD.
•	Communicated technical guidelines and structure to business key stakeholders
profile_positions.title: Service Transition Release & Testing Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Client: Walt Disney
Team Size: 5							
Responsibilities: Migration from Neoview to Teradata.
Description: The overall purpose of the CDE project is to provide the necessary platform for Disney to capture, consolidate, leverage and deliver customer information for reporting, analytics, modeling and campaign management activities.
profile_positions.title: Developer

profile_positions.description: Trained in JAVA, Groovy on grail, UNIX, Business Intelligence (data warehouse, SQL, Informatica, SAP Business Object and Teradata) in Hewlett- Packard.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Training

volunteer_experiences.description: Actively participated, organized and volunteered many extracurricular activities and team outing of around 200-300 people in Hewlett Packard Enterprise for better interaction of teammates and received many appreciations and rewards from Asia service line head of HPE for 100% successfully completing all the events.

It was a recruiting event for Marketing, Finance and Project management skilled international people, who are recently moved to The Netherlands with their spouses and looking for an opportunity to step in the corporate world of The Netherlands. I volunteered the event with Co-ordination work and as a photographer.

It was a Cultural event for entertaining old people who are suffering from mental disorder called Dementia. The Event was organized in Breda, The Netherlands for 4 hours, in which we performed some mind game activities and Indian traditional cultural activities, also cooked some India snacks for the patients.
